subject: Re: [junit] How should protected inherited method be tested?
msgSnippet: ... I assume that the overridden methods (protected/inherited) must agree with a common contract, correct? In that case, you should consider Contract Tests for
messageBody:
elmoseeriksen wrote:

> But how should i test protected inherited methods?

I assume that the overridden methods (protected/inherited) must agree
with a common contract, correct? In that case, you should consider
Contract Tests for the assertions you can make in common for all
implementations of the method you're testing. If the method also does
things that go beyond the contract, extract those to separate methods
and test them like any other private method.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca

JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
